keep up.translation[0].definitions[0].no: keep up the good work! (=continue to work hard and well)
keep up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I don’t think I can keep this up any longer.
keep up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if a situation keeps up, it continues without stopping or changing
keep up.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: How long can the economic boom keep up?
keep up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to go as quickly as someone else
keep up.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: I had to walk fast to keep up with him.
keep up.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to manage to do as much or as well as other people
keep up.translation[0].definitions[3].no: keep up with the Joneses (=try to have the same new impressive possessions that other people have)
keep up.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Jack’s having trouble keeping up with the rest of the class.
keep up.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to continue to read and learn about a particular subject, so that you always know about the most recent facts, products etc
keep up.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: Employees need to keep up with the latest technical developments.
keep up.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to make something continue at its present level or amount, instead of letting it decrease
keep up.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: NATO kept up the pressure on the Serbs to get out of Kosovo.
keep up.translation[0].definitions[6].de: if one process keeps up with another, it increases at the same speed and by the same amount
keep up.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: Food production is not keeping up with population growth.
keep up.translation[0].definitions[7].de: to continue to practise a skill so that you do not lose it
keep up.translation[0].definitions[7].ex: I used to speak French, but I haven’t kept it up.
keep up.translation[0].definitions[8].de: to prevent someone from going to bed
keep up.translation[0].definitions[8].ex: I hope I’m not keeping you up.
keep up.translation[0].definitions[9].de: to stay happy, strong, confident etc by making an effort
keep up.translation[0].definitions[9].ex: We sang as we marched, to keep our spirits up.
keep up.translation[0].definitions[10].d: to pretend that everything in your life is normal and happy even though you are in trouble, especially financial trouble
keep up.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to prevent something from falling to a lower level
keep up.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The high demand for cereals was responsible for keeping agricultural wages up with prices.
keep up.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to continue to make payments such as rent etc on time
keep up.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Your home is at risk if you do notkeep up repayments on a mortgage.
keep up.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to achieve the same rate of progress as other people, organizations etc, so that they do not have an advantage over you
keep up.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: Some firms have used technical agreements with foreign enterprises to keep up technologically.
We have to move fast to keep up with our competitors.
